sub_topic: Predicting the molecular geometry of a molecule
message_1: What is the molecular geometry of a molecule that has 2 bonding pairs and 2 lone pairs of electrons on its central atom?
message_2: The molecular geometry of a molecule with 2 bonding pairs and 2 lone pairs of electrons on its central atom is bent or angular (V-shaped). This geometry occurs because the lone pairs of electrons occupy more space and repel the bonding pairs, causing the molecule to have a bent shape.
